content:
Hi, working on my first pull request! I'm getting stuck on CI, specifically "check all files imported". I have modified one existing file and created another brand-new one.

I can get a green check on "check all files imported" (but not "build") if I put "import Mathlib.Algebra.PresentedMonoid.Basic.lean" in Mathlib.lean. This seems wrong -- I shouldn't have the .lean. (and consequently, it gives me a build error, uncaught exception : inappropriate type).

But when I leave any part of that string out from Mathlib.lean, it won't pass "check all files imported". Is there some other way I should be importing the new file I created?
@Hannah Fechtner can you please link to the PR?

Johan Commelin said:

Hannah Fechtner can you please link to the PR?

https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/tree/hannahfechtner_presented_monoid

@Hannah Fechtner Thanks. I think I found it

$ git diff master... --stat
 Mathlib.lean                                    |   1 +
 Mathlib/Algebra/FreeMonoid/Basic.lean           | 160 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 Mathlib/Algebra/PresentedMonoid.lean/Basic.lean | 251 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 3 files changed, 412 insertions(+)
That filename Mathlib/Algebra/PresentedMonoid.lean/Basic.lean doesn't look right :wink:
Can you please rename the folder to PresentedMonoid and try again?

oh WOW that was silly of me
thank you!!
The content looks similar to file#Mathlib/GroupTheory/Congruence. Is there any way we can merge them?
Also note that you can simply run ./scripts/mk_all.sh to update Mathlib.lean

Yaël Dillies said:

Also note that you can simply run ./scripts/mk_all.sh to update Mathlib.lean

I'll do that in the future, thanks!

Andrew Yang said:

The content looks similar to file#Mathlib/GroupTheory/Congruence. Is there any way we can merge them?

thanks for the pointer! i'm going to try using the Con structure in my code to see if I can make any of the proofs shorter
Hannah Fechtner has marked this topic as resolved.

Yaël Dillies said:

Also note that you can simply run ./scripts/mk_all.sh to update Mathlib.lean

I just learnt this trick a few minutes ago. I had a problem in #13167 because E comes before a in the alphabetical order, apparently.
Hopefully, soon you will be able to do lake exe mk_all and use Lean itself to update these files! #11874.

Andrew Yang said:

The content looks similar to file#Mathlib/GroupTheory/Congruence. Is there any way we can merge them?

done! well, at least mine is now built on top of the Congruence stuff, and I put my more-general results into the Congruence file itself

Damiano Testa said:

Hopefully, soon you will be able to do lake exe mk_all and use Lean itself to update these files! #11874.

(That PR has landed now.)
